summary: The National Plan for Epilepsy Act proposes a national plan to coordinate research and resources related to epilepsy. It mandates the Secretary of Health to establish and maintain a plan for prevention, diagnosis, treatment, and cure of epilepsy. The bill includes the creation of an Advisory Council on Epilepsy, requires annual assessments and reports to Congress, and promotes data sharing among relevant agencies. The plan aims to improve diagnosis, care coordination, research, and public awareness of epilepsy.
